title: Riverbridge Partners LLC Trims Stock Position in Bio-Techne Corp $TECH
summary: Riverbridge Partners LLC reduced its stake in Bio-Techne Corp ($TECH) by 5.1% in Q3, now holding 906,442 shares valued at approximately $50.4 million. Despite missing revenue expectations, Bio-Techne reported Q3 EPS in line with estimates and maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus from analysts with an average price target of $71. The company also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.08 per share.

title: Balefire LLC Has $9.29 Million Stock Holdings in Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Balefire LLC increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) by 8.5% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 17,928 shares valued at $9.29 million, making it the firm's 8th largest position. Microsoft recently reported stronger-than-expected quarterly earnings and revenue, with positive Azure AI margins and significant investments in AI and cloud infrastructure in India. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for MSFT, with several firms raising their price targets to the mid-$600s.

title: Sound Income Strategies LLC Reduces Position in International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
Quantum Computing Stocks Week Ahead (Dec 22–26, 2025): IonQ, D-Wave, Rigetti and QUBT Face a Holiday-Shortened Test After Fresh Wall Street Calls
summary: The article analyzes the outlook for quantum computing stocks, including IonQ (IONQ), D-Wave Quantum (QBTS), Rigetti Computing (RGTI), and Quantum Computing Inc. (QUBT), during a holiday-shortened trading week from December 22–26, 2025. It highlights recent Wall Street coverage and increased analyst interest in the sector, noting that thin liquidity during the holidays could exaggerate market moves. The piece also discusses specific company catalysts, macroeconomic factors, and risks that could influence these volatile technology stocks.

title: Wedge Capital Management L L P NC Lowers Stake in CVS Health Corporation $CVS
summary: Wedge Capital Management L L P NC reduced its stake in CVS Health Corporation by 19.7% in the third quarter, selling 95,782 shares and ending with 390,797 shares valued at $29.46 million. Despite this, several major institutional investors increased their positions, with hedge funds and institutional investors collectively owning about 80.66% of the company. CVS Health reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst expectations, and received a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating with a $94.67 price target from analysts.

title: Foster Victor Wealth Advisors LLC Raises Stake in International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: Foster Victor Wealth Advisors LLC significantly increased its stake in International Business Machines Corporation ($IBM) by 2,905.4% in the third quarter of 2025, bringing their total holdings to $15.686 million. This comes after IBM reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates with $2.65 EPS and $16.33 billion in revenue, and announced a $1.68 quarterly dividend. Wall Street analysts currently give IBM a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $293.38.

title: Red Door Wealth Management LLC Acquires 1,831 Shares of International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: Red Door Wealth Management LLC has increased its stake in International Business Machines (NYSE:IBM) by 53.8%, acquiring an additional 1,831 shares to now hold 5,232 shares valued at approximately $1.476 million. This comes as IBM reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates on both EPS and revenue, and declared a quarterly dividend of $1.68. The company currently holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average target price of $293.38.

title: Flputnam Investment Management Co. Purchases 7,750 Shares of International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: Flputnam Investment Management Co. increased its stake in International Business Machines Corporation (NYSE:IBM) by 8.1% in Q3, acquiring an additional 7,750 shares, bringing its total holding to 103,108 shares valued at $29.09 million. This move comes as IBM reported strong Q3 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations with $2.65 EPS and $16.33 billion in revenue, reflecting a 9.1% year-over-year growth. The company also announced a quarterly dividend of $1.68, contributing to an annualized yield of 2.2%, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $293.38.

title: Redhawk Wealth Advisors Inc. Sells 4,198 Shares of International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: Redhawk Wealth Advisors Inc. reduced its stake in International Business Machines Corporation (NYSE:IBM) by 82.0% in Q3 2025, selling 4,198 shares and retaining 920 shares valued at approximately $260,000. Despite this sale, IBM holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $293.38. The company recently surpassed Q3 earnings expectations with $2.65 EPS and $16.33 billion in revenue, and offers an annualized dividend of $6.72, yielding about 2.2%.

title: Agentic AI to drive autonomous enterprises by 2026, says Wipro CTO
summary: Wipro CTO Sandhya Arun predicts that by 2026, Agentic AI will lead to autonomous enterprises where networks of AI agents manage complex business workflows across various functions. This shift will involve a fundamental change in the human workforce's role from execution to orchestration, with a focus on specialized, domain-native AI models. Workforce readiness and continuous skilling will be crucial for enterprises to thrive in this AI-first world.

title: International Business Machines (NYSE:IBM) Stock Rating Lowered by Wall Street Zen
summary: Wall Street Zen downgraded International Business Machines (NYSE:IBM) from a "buy" to a "hold" rating, while other analysts have issued varying ratings from "Strong Buy" to "Sell". Despite the downgrade, IBM recently exceeded Q3 EPS and revenue estimates. The company maintains a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price of $293.38 based on 17 analyst ratings.

title: Fairvoy Private Wealth LLC Has $5.36 Million Holdings in International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: Fairvoy Private Wealth LLC significantly increased its stake in International Business Machines (IBM) by 14.5%, now holding 19,009 shares valued at approximately $5.36 million, making IBM its 25th largest holding. IBM reported strong quarterly earnings, beating expectations with an EPS of $2.65 and revenue of $16.33 billion, and offers a quarterly dividend of $1.68. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for IBM with a consensus target price of $293.38.

title: Hungary Advances in AI Use as Microsoft Predicts Major Shift
summary: A new Microsoft study indicates that Hungary is well-prepared to adopt AI advancements, evolving from a practical tool to a digital partner by 2026. AI use in Hungary saw strong momentum in 2025, with penetration increasing by nearly 28%, surpassing the EU average. This shift is set to democratize innovation, allowing organizations and individuals to leverage AI for collaboration and problem-solving across various sectors.

title: Firefly Aerospace Stock (NASDAQ: FLY) News Today, Dec. 19, 2025: Analyst Coverage, Lawsuit Deadline, and What Investors Are Watching
summary: Firefly Aerospace stock (NASDAQ: FLY) experienced high volatility on December 19, 2025, driven by KeyBanc initiating coverage with a "Sector Weight" rating and reminders about an investor class-action lawsuit with a January 12, 2026 deadline for lead plaintiff status. The company is actively building its Alpha launch cadence, expanding lunar services with Blue Ghost Mission 2, and strengthening its national security software capabilities through the SciTec acquisition, alongside onboarding a new COO to enhance operational scaling. Investors are closely watching Alpha Flight 7 timing, Blue Ghost Mission 2 milestones, SciTec integration, and legal case developments, with the next earnings report expected on February 25, 2026.

title: IBM stock split: what’s next for IBM shares?
summary: IBM has a long history of stock splits, with its last traditional split being a 2-for-1 action in 1999 to make shares more appealing to individual investors. While IBM has not announced any future splits for 2025 or 2026, the company continues to focus on its hybrid cloud, AI, and automation strategy, as evidenced by its strong FY2025 earnings. Speculation about future splits remains unfounded, with the company emphasizing its 1999 split as its last traditional one.

title: U.S. Capital Wealth Advisors LLC Buys 9,993 Shares of International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: U.S. Capital Wealth Advisors LLC increased its stake in International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) by 22% in the third quarter, purchasing 9,993 additional shares to bring its total holdings to 55,388 shares valued at $15.63 million. IBM exceeded Q3 expectations with EPS of $2.65 and revenue of $16.33 billion, a 9.1% year-over-year increase, and analysts currently hold a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for the stock. The company also recently declared a quarterly dividend of $1.68 per share, representing an annualized dividend of $6.72 and a 2.2% yield.

title: Quantum Computing Stocks Today: IonQ, D-Wave, Rigetti and QUBT Move in US Premarket on Fresh Deals and New Wall Street Targets (Dec. 19, 2025)
summary: U.S.-listed quantum computing stocks, including IonQ, D-Wave, Rigetti, and QUBT, are seeing premarket moves due to fresh deals, new partnerships, an M&A-driven photonics acquisition, and new Wall Street coverage with ambitious 2026 price targets. Investors are weighing these near-term catalysts against the long-term question of how quickly "quantum promise" can translate into durable revenue. The article highlights company-specific news such as IonQ's expanded Swiss partnership and new Jefferies target, Rigetti's system orders and Wedbush initiation, D-Wave's new coverage and institutional interest, and QUBT's acquisition of Luminar Semiconductor.

title: IBM Commits To Skill 5 Million Indians In AI, Cybersecurity & Quantum By 2030
summary: IBM (International Business Machines Corp) has pledged to train 5 million people in India in artificial intelligence, cybersecurity, and quantum computing by the year 2030. This initiative highlights IBM's commitment to enhancing digital skills in the Indian workforce. The announcement was made via Reuters.

title: Michigan regulators sign off on DTE agreement for massive data center
summary: Michigan's Public Service Commission has approved DTE Energy's plan to power a massive hyperscale data center in Saline Township, despite significant opposition. The agreement will supply 1.4 gigawatts of computing power for a project backed by Related Digital, Oracle, and OpenAI, which is part of OpenAI's "Stargate" initiative for AI development. Opponents, including environmental groups and the Attorney General's Office, raised concerns about the project's energy demands and potential impact on the electric grid and residential rates, while supporters highlight job creation and economic benefits.

title: IGM, IBM, SHOP, ACN: Large Outflows Detected at ETF
summary: The iShares Expanded Tech Sector ETF (IGM) experienced significant outflows of approximately $87.6 million, marking a 1.0% decrease in shares outstanding week-over-week. This reduction in units means the ETF had to sell some of its underlying holdings, with major components like IBM and Accenture plc seeing declines, while Shopify Inc showed gains. The article also provides IGM's one-year price performance and a comparison to its 200-day moving average.

title: Caterpillar (CAT) Stock on Dec. 18, 2025: CPI Surprise, Fresh Filings, Dividend Clarity, and 2026 Price Targets
summary: Caterpillar (CAT) stock gained traction on December 18, 2025, buoyed by a cooler-than-expected CPI report and a rebound after a prior day's selloff. The article details new ownership filings, including increased stakes by Czech National Bank and Legacy Private Trust Co., and a purchase by Rep. Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr. It also covers dividend stability, strategic analyses linking Caterpillar to AI infrastructure, and a range of analyst price targets for 2026, highlighting both bullish factors like backlog and AI demand, and bearish concerns around tariffs and valuation.

title: JPMorgan Reinstates Palo Alto Networks (PANW) With Overweight Rating
summary: JPMorgan reinstated coverage of Palo Alto Networks (PANW) with an Overweight rating and a $235 price target, highlighting the company's comprehensive security platform and potential for long-term growth. The company reported strong fiscal Q1 2026 results, with revenue up 16% year-over-year to $2.47 billion, driven by its platform strategy and next-generation security offerings. JPMorgan sees Palo Alto Networks as a long-term share gainer in the cybersecurity market.

title: 5 storage industry predictions for 2026
summary: This article forecasts five key trends for the storage industry in 2026, including the continued imperative to make data and storage AI-ready, potential storage component shortages impacting AI deployments, the evolution of cyber-resilience in primary storage, the increasing influence of digital sovereignty on data residency, and the ongoing evolution of the storage administrator's role. These trends highlight the dynamic nature of the storage and data infrastructure sector, driven by advancements in AI, security concerns, and regulatory pressures.

title: HCLTech to Acquire Telco Solutions Business from Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) to Further Strengthen its Engineering and AI-led Network Propositions to Global Communication Service Providers
summary: HCLTech has signed an agreement to acquire HPE's Telco Solutions business, enhancing its capabilities in engineering, AI, and cloud-native offerings for the telecom industry. This acquisition will bring in intellectual property, R&D talent, and client relationships from HPE's Telco Solutions, which supports over a billion devices globally. The deal aims to accelerate network transformation and AI-led autonomous networking, integrating nearly 1,500 HPE specialists into HCLTech.

title: IoT Technology Market Analysis 2025-2032: Revenues to Grow by $319 Billion | Features Profiles of Amazon, Microsoft, Cisco Systems, IBM, Alphabet, Intel, Huawei, Hewlett Packard, Siemens, SAP - ResearchAndMarkets.com
summary: The "IoT Technology Market - Global Forecast 2025-2032" report indicates significant growth, with the market projected to reach $797.98 billion by 2032 from $478.28 billion in 2025, demonstrating a CAGR of 7.58%. This expansion is driven by sustained enterprise commitment to connectivity and automation, transforming industrial, commercial, and consumer operations. The report details strategic coverage areas including components, end-user industries, connectivity types, and deployment models, while also profiling key companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and IBM.

title: Ipswich Investment Management Co. Inc. Has $3.31 Million Stake in International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: Ipswich Investment Management Co. Inc. reduced its stake in IBM by 13.2% in Q3, now holding 11,740 shares valued at $3.313 million. Despite this, IBM reported strong Q3 earnings, beating estimates with an EPS of $2.65 and revenue of $16.33 billion, a 9.1% year-over-year increase. The company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with a target price of $293.38 and offers a 2.2% dividend yield.

title: International Business Machines (NYSE:IBM) Shares Acquired Rep. Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr.
summary: Representative Gilbert Ray Cisneros, Jr. recently acquired between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of International Business Machines (NYSE:IBM) stock on November 12th, as disclosed in a December 15th filing. This purchase comes after IBM reported strong quarterly earnings, beating expectations with $2.65 EPS and $16.33 billion in revenue, along with a consistent quarterly dividend of $1.68 per share. Analyst sentiment for IBM is mixed, with a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating and a target price of $293.38, though individual ratings vary.

title: Tata, Infosys To Bear Brunt Of Trump's $1,00,000 H-1B Worker Fee
summary: Former President Donald Trump's proposed $100,000 fee for new H-1B workers hired from outside the US could significantly impact IT outsourcing and staffing industries. Companies like Tata Consultancy Services, Infosys, and Cognizant Technology Solutions would have faced hundreds of millions in additional costs had this fee been in effect for new hires between May 2020 and May 2024. Industry experts anticipate a steep drop in visa demand and increased offshoring of jobs, despite potential legal challenges against the fee.

title: Lear Corp. Inducted Into The Billion Dollar Roundtable
summary: Lear Corp., a global supplier of automotive seating and electrical systems, has been inducted into the Billion Dollar Roundtable Inc. (BDR). This recognition highlights Lear's significant increase in supplier diversity, exceeding $1 billion in sourcing with women and minority suppliers. The BDR is an advocacy organization that promotes supply chain diversity excellence among top corporations.

title: Grant Private Wealth Management Inc Sells 1,742 Shares of International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
summary: Grant Private Wealth Management Inc reduced its stake in International Business Machines (IBM) by 43.1% in the third quarter, selling 1,742 shares and retaining 2,297 shares valued at approximately $648,000. Despite this sale, IBM has received "Moderate Buy" consensus ratings from analysts with a target price of $293.38, after beating Q3 earnings estimates. The company's stock currently trades near $303 and offers an annualized dividend of $6.72, yielding about 2.2%.

title: IBM and Pearson Team Up on AI-Powered Learning
summary: IBM and Pearson have announced a global partnership focused on AI-powered learning to create more personalized tools for businesses, public-sector groups, and schools. This collaboration aims to help individuals acquire skills faster and transition between roles smoothly, addressing the costly issue of skills gaps. IBM will assist Pearson in developing a custom AI-driven learning platform, and Pearson's enterprise learning products will be integrated across IBM’s customer base and workforce.

title: IBM and Pearson Team Up on AI-Powered Learning
summary: IBM and Pearson have announced a global partnership to deliver AI-powered learning tools aimed at creating more personalized education for businesses, public-sector groups, and schools. This collaboration seeks to address costly skills gaps by helping individuals acquire skills more quickly and transition smoothly between roles. IBM will develop a custom AI-driven learning platform for Pearson, while Pearson's enterprise learning products will be rolled out to IBM's customer base and workforce.

title: Hawaiian Electric Industries, Inc. (NYSE:HE) Given Average Rating of "Hold" by Analysts
summary: Hawaiian Electric Industries (NYSE:HE) has received a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $12.13. The company recently reported a surprise Q3 EPS of $0.19 against an estimated ($0.20), and analysts expect $1.71 EPS for the current fiscal year. Institutional investors hold nearly 60% of the stock, with some increasing their positions.

title: Trump’s H-1B visa crackdown: Why $100,000 fee will hit TCS, Infosys - explained
summary: US President Donald Trump's proposed $100,000 fee for H-1B visas is expected to significantly impact Indian IT giants like TCS and Infosys, potentially costing them hundreds of millions of dollars. The substantial levy aims to reduce reliance on foreign workers and could lead to a shift towards offshore recruitment and fewer visa applications. Analysts anticipate a significant reduction in visa applications and increased overseas staff deployment as companies adapt to these new regulations.

title: Aaron Wealth Advisors LLC Purchases 35,115 Shares of Genpact Limited $G
summary: Aaron Wealth Advisors LLC significantly increased its stake in Genpact Limited, purchasing an additional 35,115 shares and bringing their total holdings to 43,161 shares valued at $1.81 million. This comes as Genpact beat Q3 earnings estimates, issued strong FY2025 guidance, and announced a quarterly dividend. Insider selling has also been noted, with SVP Sameer Dewan and Director Tamara Franklin reducing their positions.

title: Is It Too Late to Consider IBM After Its Big Hybrid Cloud and AI Driven Rally?
summary: IBM has seen significant gains, up 37.8% year to date and 215.8% over five years, driven by its hybrid cloud and AI strategy. Despite this rally, traditional valuation metrics suggest IBM is not broadly undervalued, with its DCF indicating it's slightly overvalued. However, a "Fair Ratio" analysis based on P/E suggests it might still be undervalued compared to its fundamentals, presenting a nuanced picture for potential investors.

title: How to future-proof machine learning operations during major market shifts
summary: This article provides a practical guide for data science practitioners and business leaders on how to respond to and mitigate the impact of disruptions on machine learning models during major market shifts, like those caused by COVID. It outlines strategies for understanding model degradation, establishing reactive standards, and building resilient models and data operations. The piece emphasizes the importance of MLOps for integrating machine learning with software development best practices to ensure continuous business value.

title: Merck (MRK) Stock News Today: Why Shares Slid on Dec. 16, 2025 as Analysts Reassess Keytruda, Winrevair, and Merck’s Post‑Patent Strategy
summary: Merck (MRK) shares experienced a decline on December 16, 2025, driven by broad market pressures and ongoing re-evaluation by analysts concerning the company's key drugs, Keytruda and Winrevair, and its strategy for growth post-Keytruda patent expiry. The company's future stock performance hinges on the success of Winrevair's expanded indications, the subcutaneous version of Keytruda, strategic acquisitions, and the management of Keytruda's patent and pricing challenges. Investors are monitoring upcoming catalysts such as the European Commission's decision on Winrevair, the Cidara deal closing, Q4 2025 earnings, and the rollout of Keytruda Qlex.

title: Copiers: Global Market Intelligence and Company Benchmarks 2025-2030 Featuring 41 Players - Canon, HP, Panasonic, Xerox, ZTE and More - ResearchAndMarkets.com
summary: The global copiers market is projected to grow from US$738 Million in 2024 to US$880.7 Million by 2030, driven by the need for cost-effective document processing, integration of smart features, and shift to secure remote handling. Key factors influencing market growth include hybrid work models, cloud connectivity, environmental consciousness, and increasing demand from document-intensive sectors. The report offers comprehensive market analysis, regional insights, and profiles of leading players in the industry.

title: Constructing the AI Landscape: OpenAI Coordinates with Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
summary: Brasada Capital Management highlighted Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) in its Q3 2025 investor letter, noting OpenAI's strategic deal to purchase 6 gigawatts of AMD's chips. This partnership aims to diversify OpenAI's chip supply and reduce reliance on a single vendor, positioning AMD as a key player in the expanding AI ecosystem. In exchange, AMD granted OpenAI warrants for up to 160 million shares, or roughly 10% of the company.

title: Palo Alto Networks warns that AI is driving a surge in cloud security risks
summary: According to a new report from Palo Alto Networks Inc., artificial intelligence has significantly amplified cloud security risks in 2025, with 99% of organizations using generative AI tools experiencing at least one attack. The report highlights increased API attacks and persistent identity and access management weaknesses as critical challenges. It recommends strengthening security in the development lifecycle and prioritizing identity, permissions, and automation to mitigate growing threats.

title: 2 Reasons IBM is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: IBM has underperformed the S&P 500, with concerns stemming from its sluggish 1.3% compounded annual revenue growth and only 4.2% EPS growth over the last five years. The stock's current valuation at 25.5x forward P/E suggests it's overvalued, leading analysts to recommend other high-quality software and edge computing picks instead.

title: Salesforce (CRM) Stock After Hours Today (Dec. 15, 2025): Why Shares Fell, What’s Moving the AI Thesis, and What to Watch Before Tuesday’s Open
summary: Salesforce (CRM) shares fell on Monday, December 15, 2025, influenced by a broader market shift away from AI and mega-cap tech stocks, along with macro data risks. Despite the decline, analysts remain largely bullish on Salesforce's long-term AI monetization potential through its Agentforce platform. Investors are keenly watching the upcoming U.S. Jobs Report and Salesforce's Agentforce World Tour Chicago event for any catalysts that could impact the stock.

title: International Business Machines Insider Lowered Holding By 30% During Last Year
summary: Over the last year, insiders at International Business Machines (NYSE:IBM) were net sellers, with the Senior VP of Software & Chief Commercial Officer, Robert Thomas, making a significant sale of US$6.7 million worth of shares. This sale, representing 30% of his holding, occurred below the current stock price, which typically suggests a lower valuation was acceptable to the insider. Despite this, insiders still own 0.1% of the company, valued at approximately US$288 million.

title: $6.6 Billion Network Monitoring Market Outlook, 2032: Shares and Strategy Analysis of Key Players Cisco, Hewlett Packard, NetScout Systems, Viavi Solutions, Paessler and More - ResearchAndMarkets.com
summary: The global network monitoring market is projected to grow from $2.88 billion in 2024 to $6.60 billion by 2032, driven by digital transformation, cloud migration, and security demands. Key players like Cisco, IBM, and Hewlett Packard Enterprise offer solutions addressing diverse enterprise needs across monitoring types, deployment modes, organization sizes, and end-user sectors. Strategic insights highlight the importance of comprehensive platforms, cloud/hybrid approaches, automation, real-time analytics, and alignment with corporate governance for operational resilience and risk management.

title: International Business Machines Corporation $IBM Shares Acquired by Valeo Financial Advisors LLC
summary: Valeo Financial Advisors LLC increased its stake in IBM by 16.7%, acquiring an additional 2,480 shares to bring their total holdings to 17,317 shares valued at approximately $5.105 million. Analyst consensus rates IBM as a "Moderate Buy" with an average target price of $293.38. IBM recently surpassed quarterly earnings and revenue estimates and pays a quarterly dividend.
